fields.summary: Convert Pie Chart Portlet

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-16810].
  {panel}

Currently JIRA does not allow for attachements in different character encoding to be stored correctly.

JIRA should "ask" the user for the file encoding at upload time, store this in the database and server it in that encoding later when its downloaded.

For example FishEye does exactly this today with a little select box next to the upload link.

This would then allow people to attach files in say UTF-8, Kanjii, ebcidic whatever to JIRA and have them download correctly.



NOTE : This would a be a great 20% time project for Atlassian... hint hint...
fields.summary: Ask for and store the file encoding when attaching files to JIRA
Convert Favourite Fitlers
Convert Quicklinks portlet
Convert Intro Portlet
Convert legacy portlets to Gadgets

fields.description:
We would still like a way to search for a wildcard or a blank field.

<user>
Need to generate JIRA searches/views for blank fields, both text and date formats
As part of managing a JIRA module database, I need to be able to search for fields that are blank. For example, the only way to determine if a replacement has been shipped to a customer is to check for the Return to Customer Ship Date field. If the field is blank, then the unit has not had a replacement sent. 
However, I have not found a way to select the records where this field is blank. 
</user>

Currently we export to Excel and sort, but that's a little painful and our system is growing past the point where that is practical.

We are still using Enterprise Edition, Version: 3.6.2-#156
fields.summary: Need to generate JIRA searches/views for blank fields, both text and date formats

fields.description:
Sorry for poor English.

When load of our service increase, we start to eventually detect, what loged in user becomes another user. In all cases users become ones which uses SOAP -RPC (we have some integration solutions and lot of Mylyn users). At now load from RPC is about 30% of all load.
Today we finish investigation which points to ActionContext and IssueServiceImpl. IssueServiceImpl has method setUserInJira, which make RPC user looks like another user for a moment. ActionContext.getSession (ThreadLocal) Returns map which envelope INSTANCE of HttpSession. First of all storing this instance produces unperiodic eventually IllegalStateException, but it's not major issue. Looks like that ThreadLocaled session is very very bad solution. Now we have about 3.5K RPS in peak. 
Now we make a workaround and sets empty ActionContext on each request. Will be grate if you investigate ant realise good solution, but i think what using such type of session is very bad solution.
fields.summary: Unpredictional user changes

fields.description:
Users in the Project Administrators Role may need to access the group member list during Project Role maintenance; clicking on group names will take to the group management page which is protected by seraph and requires admin privileges (which the user may not possess).

It would be useful to remove this limitation, even by providing the list read-only.

Regards,
Edoardo
fields.summary: Restrictions to User/Group Administration Console - Project Administrators may require RO access

fields.description:
If you install a Plugins 1 plugin in installed-plugins, then you receive a nasty stacktrace in the log.

It is made more confusing by a bug in the plugins framework that masks the original issues, and complains about a null name instead.
fields.summary: JIRA does not handle Plugins 1 plugins in the installed-plugins folder.

fields.description:
For example, in the Bonnie project, [this page|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/BONNIE] has a link like this:

[Create a new issue in project atlassian-bonnie|http://jira.atlassian.com/secure/CreateIssue!default.jspa?pid=11843]

Clicking on that link doesn't actually select the project from the project dropdown in the create issue page.
fields.summary: Browse project link "Create an issue in this project" doesn't correctly select project on create issue screen

fields.description:
I would like to have a custom field that can display not only the current value of the field, but also its previous values. This is vaguely similar to, but also somewhat different from the Change History. I have a specific problem to solve, but I also think there might be other uses from this functionality.

The specific thing I'm trying to do is in a workflow that has a review process. The review cycle may be executed an unknown number of time (usually more than once). Each time through the process, I want to capture the name of the person who is reviewing, an indication that they have signed off (or not), and the date & time. I initially thought I would just be able to create a custom field for each of these three bits of information, but then I realised that if the issue needed to be reviewed again, the next reviewer would "over-write" the previous reviewer's field values. 

Although the changes would be logged in the issue's Change History, it might not be easy to find them. What I really want to see is all the previous values of JUST these three field, all in one place. Effectively, this would be a table with each row showing the reviewer, their sign-off (or not), and the date.

Firstly, is there an existing way of doing this? I'm relatively new to JIRA, and I'm still learning how to configure it.
If not, is there a third party extension or p[lug-in? I've searched and haven't found anything, but I'm not sure what to call this type of functionality: audit history? field versioning? 

Where could this sort of functionality be used? Anywhere where more than one user has in input.
Reviews, approvals, and sign-offs - all the sorts of activities where you're expecting parallel inputs
Voting  - eg. you want to record a score from 1 to 5 from multiple users.
Budgeting - eg. various team leaders can enter the anticipated costs from their own team.

thanks,
P
fields.summary: New custom field type that saves and displays previous field values (like an audit trail or a one dimensional array)

fields.description:
An odd omission in the documentation is that searching for Mail Queue Service doesn't find much useful for a new user. There is a screen shot somewhere showing how to add a service but if a user wants to change the interval at which mail is sent from JIRA, they need to know to go to Admin, Services, Mail Queue Service, Edit. Not a big deal, just something missing. The closest I found was the reference on http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/v3.13/services.html to "Editing Service Properties". Perhaps just adding a sentence there such as: 

"For example, to change the interval at which email is sent from JIRA, select the Mail Queue Service and change the interval from the default value of 1 minute"

{quote}
Matt, if you could raise a ticket in jira.atlassian.com under the JIRA project with a component of 'Documentation' and describe your proposed changes, I'll have a look and make the necessary updates.

Kind Regards,
Andrew
{quote}
fields.summary: How to change the interval of the Mail Queue Service
Sorting character fields should be case neutral
A new section "JIRA Configuration" is needed in System Info page

fields.description:
We have an onjira subscription, I just noticed that it is loading images from a strange domain www.yourottawaregion.com . I looked at the source of the page and found the following code. 

            <option id="issuetype100008" class="10000" value="8" style="background-image: url(http://www.yourottawaregion.com/images/structural/icon_email16x16.gif);"
                        >Send Email </option>

            <option id="issuetype100009" class="10000" value="9" style="background-image: url(http://www.google.com/a/help/intl/en/security/images/phone_icon-16.gif);"
                        >Phone</option>
            
I don't think the product should be deep linking anywhere else. I attach html page for your reference.
fields.summary: jira installation loading images from www.yourottawaregion.com + google.com

fields.description:
JIRA has had, for a long time, a filter to translate certain characters from the CP1252 codepage. These caused issues with MS Word data in JIRA issues displaying incorrectly on non-Windows systems.

There is a bug in the method - {{StringUtils.escapeCP1252()}} - that performs this escaping. This bug causes these special characters to be escaped in UTF-8 as well as CP1252. This is documented in CORE-100.

The customer impact of this is that customers cannot use JIRA with Crowd and Active Directory if they have group names that contain em-dash or en-dash. These look like hyphens, but aren't.

Confluence and Crowd no longer use the WordCurlyQuotesFilter that causes this problem. I'd be very happy if JIRA could either a) also abandon it, or b) fix CORE-100.
fields.summary: JIRA is using the buggy CurlyQuotesFilter which breaks Crowd integration for groups that contain em-dash and en-dash

At the moment they only respond (close) when you click outside of the menu
fields.summary: Dropdown menus in JIRA should respond to Esc

Therefore Confluence would always be removed f you select Bamboo.

fields.description: We reinitialise the plugins system when going from Step 1 to Step 2 during setup.  This now takes 20+ seconds which is a pretty long wait for customers trialling JIRA.  Reinitialising the plugins system probably isn't even necessary any longer.
fields.summary: Getting to Setup step2 takes 20+ seconds since plugins2

fields.description:
Since we include the maxActive parameter for tomcat installation notes to configure the database connection pool, we should consider doing the same for JBoss

e.g.
{code:xml}<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<!-- DataSource for JIRA webapp,
     called 'JiraDS' (must be same in entityengine.xml) -->
<datasources>
  <local-tx-datasource>
    <jndi-name>JiraDS</jndi-name>
    <connection-url>jdbc:mysql://localhost/jirajboss?autoReconnect=true&useUnicode=true&characterEncoding=UTF8</connection-url>
    <driver-class>com.mysql.jdbc.Driver</driver-class>
    <user-name>jira_mysql_username</user-name>
    <password>jira_mysql_password</password>
    <min-pool-size>5</min-pool-size>
    <max-pool-size>10</max-pool-size>
  </local-tx-datasource>
</datasources>
{code}

{{min-pool-size}} and {{max-pool-size}} are used to configure the minimum and maximum connection pool sizes respectively.
fields.summary: Include connection pool size details in JBoss 4 installation notes

fields.description:
On the top bar in Jira, there is a drop down menu called History. It is populated with links to issues I have looked at.

This is a very good list, very usable.

However, it gets emptied at logout. It would be great to keep them between sessions. Let's say the 50 latest issues.
fields.summary: Keep history between sessions (logins)

fields.description:
Whenever a schema name is specified in the {{entityengine.xml}} file JIRA fails to find the tables themselves and attempts to create them (this time honoring the schema location). While the application does function correctly thereafter it does create unnecessary alarm and could mask eventual legitimate problems with the database configuration.

Problem is repeatable on postgres, oracle and MSSQL.
fields.summary: On startup JIRA fails to search for Tables in the specified schema name
URL custom field JQL searching
read-only text custom field jql searching
Free Text custom field JQL searching

fields.summary: Issue Navigator leaves ugly gap between filter fields in view mode and issue list on IE (IE7)
JQL "User Picker & Group" Custom field Searching
Add sanitisation to JQL queries

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-16764].
  {panel}

The statuses should be sortable in the administration UI. We have multiple projects with many different statuses.
From what I could see from JRA-5189, the statuses are sorted by SEQUENCE.
It would be nice to able to sort these from the admin interface.

To be clear on how this is different from JRA-5189:
I'm not asking for a change to the end-user view of statuses, but the ability to sort the columns (Status Details (the name) and Mode (Active/Inactive)) on the administration page.
We have over 63 statuses that have been added and it is difficult at times to see which statuses exist as we can't sort them in a meaningful way within Jira when we're adding new statuses.

Currently I copy the fields and view them in Excel and this isn't optimal.

Additionally, the page: https://jira.icainformatics.com/secure/admin/workflows/AddWorkflowStep.jspa does not list statuses in a sensible manner (presumably by sequence number and not alphabetically as well).
fields.summary: Statuses in the View Status admin page (/secure/admin/ViewStatuses.jspa) should be sortable.

fields.description:
Need ability to get a list of items based on JIRA-<numbers> . 
Currently the Quick search allows you to retrieve ONE Issue. I want to create  a list of issues and input them for a query listing.
fields.summary: FIND multiple issues

fields.description:
when i set or delete user properties property set dosn't invalidates
Looks like problem in OpenSymphony PropertySet
fields.summary: Changing user properties dosn't invalidates properties cache

fields.description:
In the notifications scheme, how about an option to wait 2 or 3 minutes before sending out a notification, in case there are any updates to follow? 

Almost all of our bugs involve someone creating the issue, and then attaching a screenshot, and often updating part of the bug they missed (like component or assignee), resulting in 2-3 emails per issue.  

Optionally, the problem could be alleviated by making "screenshot added" a distinct event from issue updated. Or making a "quiet save" option and leave the control in the users hands.

Email overload is my biggest complaint of jira right now.
fields.summary: quiet period for update notifications

fields.description: Under certain organizational circumstances it would be useful to be able to associate multiple Jira projects to one email account and have the listener dispatch issues according to a configurable key.
fields.summary: Bind multiple projects to a single email address

fields.description:
You provide goog techique for overriding components, but much code components is inbvisible for extended classes. There is two possible solutions:
1. I make copypaste of method and continue to sync among JIRA and My classes
2. You make common methods prtotected instead of private.
fields.summary: Make common methods in extendable classes more visible (protected instead private)

fields.description: An incredibly hard to track down bug in Studio was caused by some code in Studio modifying the list returned by ThreadLocalCachingPermissionManager.getProjects().  It would be helpful if the list returned by this was either a copy of the list in the cache, or an immutable list, so that the bug is found quickly in future.
fields.summary: ThreadLocalCachingPermissionManager.getProjects() returns mutable lists straight from the cache
notify me

fields.description:
This is the way to reproduce the problem:

# Create a new dashboard, and share it with a project
# Add a Shared Filter portlet in the dashboard
# Remove browse permission for that user in the project
# Go to the dashboard > Set 'Configure' to on, and try to edit the shared filter portlet

You will not get the edit portlet options. It seems like there are other areas that do not work well either. The 'Manage Dashboard' > 'Full Configure' screen misbehaves too. It does not allow the user to add portlets, edit them, or remove them.

It seems like Jira is using the same permission validation to know:

* Whether a user can share a dashboard with a project
* Whether the user can edit the dashboard

In my opinion, if a dashboard has already been shared with a project, the owner should be allowed to edit it, even though at a later stage it was removed from the browse permission for the project.
fields.summary: Edit dashboard when shared with a project the user has no browse permission over fails

fields.description:

fields.description:
We changed the SearchProvider.searchAndSort() interface to take a HitCollector instead of a DocumentHitCollector.  This isn't binary compatible and ends up breaking Greenhopper (and potentially other plugins): 
{noformat}
An error occurred whilst rendering this message. Please contact the administrators, and inform them of this bug. 
Details: ------- org.apache.velocity.exception.MethodInvocationException: Invocation of method 'computeStartFor' in class com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira.boards.VersionBoard threw exception class
java.lang.NoSuchMethodError : com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.SearchProvider.searchAndSort(Lcom/atlassian/jira/issue/search/SearchRequest;Lcom/opensymphony/user/User;Lcom/atlassian/jira/issue/statistics/util/DocumentHitCollector;Lcom/atlassian/jira/web/bean/PagerFilter;)V 
at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTMethod.execute(ASTMethod.java:246)
at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTReference.execute(ASTReference.java:175) 
at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTReference.value(ASTReference.java:327) 
at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTExpression.value(ASTExpression.java:51) 
at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTSetDirective.render(ASTSetDirective.java:95) 
...
{noformat}

I will re-introduce the old method as a deprecated method delegating through to the new method.
fields.summary: Broke SearchProvider backwards compatibility in JIRA 3.13.3
Clean up usage of DefaultOperandRegistry

fields.description: The addition of OSGi classloaders has shown up a number of memory leaks that need to be hunted down and fixed.
fields.summary: Fix any memory leaks in JIRA mainly caused by restoring data from XML and refreshing all singleton objects

fields.description:
Restore project doc has an incorrect header. 

http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/latest/restore_project.html

There are two 'JIRA versions do not match' headers. The second one should read 'JIRA editions do not match'
fields.summary: Incorrect header on restore project doc

fields.description: Currently links provided by Top Navigation plugin have system flag and cannot be disabled.
fields.summary: Make top navigation links not system

fields.description:
Our organization is using JIRA to manage the maintenance and development of 60 projects, but we have outsourced the source code generation using two external software factories and a service level agreement. We send requests to fix known defects in the applications, to upgrade existing features, or develop new features to theese software factories and we receive new versions of the applications. Our worflows are very complex and we manage a respectable bunch of different issue types and issue link types. 

    For us it would be very useful if it could be possible to restrict set of "issue types" allowed to be linked with certain "issue link type".

   This feature would avoid to stablish links between issue types for which that issue link type has no sense. It would also make easier to find the correct issue link type in the combo, as it would contain fewer elements.
fields.summary: Restrict the possible issue types to be linked with a certain issue link type

fields.description:
Performance profiling shows that a massive amount of CPU time is spent checking OFBizAccessProvider.inGroup()
The problem seems to be that although OFBizAccessProvider caches the relationships of users to groups, the way that the cache is implemented and used is not optimal.

The two main tiem we mostly use this are:
* the dashboard checking what projects the current user has permission to view.
* Calling GroupDropDown.hasPermission() from various places - seems to mostly stem from Dashboard as well.

This problem exists in 3.13, but has possibly been exacerbated on trunk by the introduction of JQL.

(Note that this issue is specific to the standard user management module, Crowd, LDAP, and other user management modules use other implementations of AccessProvider that may or may not suffer similar problems)
fields.summary: Improve the performance of checking if a user belongs to a particular group.

fields.description:
If you set {{jira.search.views.max.unlimited.group}}, the issue navigator views always have the tempMax parameter set, even if you are part of the unlimited group. 

e.g. with the following config

{noformat}# This property controls the java.text.Collator that is used when JIRA does database result search itself.
jira.search.views.default.max = 1
# Whether search results are capped to a hard limit, otherwise return a 403 (Forbidden) to the client.
# NOTE: this SHOULD BE EQUALS OR GREATER THAN than jira.search.views.default.max above, otherwise all issue navigator links will fail with a 403
jira.search.views.max.limit = 2
# Regardless of the above, users in this group will be able to request search requests that are unlimited.
jira.search.views.max.unlimited.group = jira-administrators
{noformat}

The links will always show as something like: 
 * http://localhost:8080/jira/sr/jira.issueviews:searchrequest-rss/temp/SearchRequest.xml?pid=10040&sorter/field=issuekey&sorter/order=DESC&tempMax=1

If you change the tempMax parameter you can retrieve more issues if you are part of the unlimited group.
fields.summary: TempMax parameter is always added to links for issue navigator views even when jira.search.views.max.unlimited.group is set

fields.description: JAC went into gc arrest yesterday. The heap dump showed a huge j.u.ByteArrayOutputStream associated with Axis. The heap dump and the contents of the BAOS are available on request (too large to attach)
fields.summary: SOAP search methods are unbounded - this can lead to xml-rpc generating huge xml responses causing memory problems

fields.description:
Just logged in to JIRA on http://jira.atlassian.com
first thing I can see on my dashboard - broken bars in Statistics portlet.
this is a portlet we use intensively in our projects.
See screenshot. 

With such problem we cannot upgrade to 3.13.3
fields.summary: Broken bars in Project Statistics portlet

fields.description:
I would like to add transitions to a workflow that let you do the following.  They all sound like different requests, but I believe they all have a common thread, so I'll link them together.

1.  When resolving an issue as duplicate, you should be able to specify one or more issue numbers that this issue is duplicating.  It should create "duplicates" links to each of the issues.
2.  It should be possible to create a transition that can create another issue based on the current issue, and link the two.  (Better explanation below.)
3.  It should be possible to create a transition that will perform an action on a linked issue.  (Better explanation below.)

Imagine a scenario like this.  We have an external "Bug Reports" project, and an internal "Development" project.  When an issue is reported into the "Bug Reports" project, it will have a reporter and some people who are "watchers" on it.  At some point the issue may become a "confirmed" bug, and we want to move it to development.  But we don't really want to completely MOVE it, because we still want it to show up under the old number in the "Bug Reports" database.  Instead, we want a transition that does the following:

1. Sets the status of the "Bug Reports" issue to "In Development"
2. Creates a clone of an issue, into another project ("Clone and Move", which is a feature you don't really support.)
3. Links the two issues using a link type of our choosing ("is tracking" / "is tracked by" or something like that).

Now, this new issue in the "Development" project can have a completely independent status, version, and everything else, and watchers of the original issue aren't notified when it actually moves from "Open" to "In Progress", or if we schedule it for the next release, but then change our minds.

When we then finish testing the "Development" issue, we'd like to create a transition like "Release" that will then modify the original linked "Bug Reports" issue, like changing the status to Fixed and adding a comment that says what version it was released in.

This concept of linked issues is important for many companies.  I applaud Atlassian for being so open as to use the same internal and external tracking systems, but I don't think most companies can get away with this.  Let me reiterate some of the problems.  For us in development, resolving an issue as fixed doesn't mean it is ready to deliver to a customer.  It then needs to be code reviewed, and then integrated to the main branch, and then tested by QA.  And we need documentation for it, and so on.  In many cases, we may fix an issue, but then decide we don't have time to test it adequately, or it is too risky for the next release, so we pull it and do it later.  If customers actually saw some of this process, they would blow a gasket.  "You told me it would be fixed in the next release!"  And by "customers", I don't even mean only external ones either, I will include our own sales and support personnel, who will pass the information on to customers even if it isn't in an outward facing system.

I guess what I am trying to say is, you have this workflow system, and you have this concept of linking issues, but the two features are totally disconnected.  Being able to create a new linked JIRA issue, or modify linked issues, seems like a very fundamental thing a workflow should allow.
fields.summary: Need ability to create and link issues as part of a workflow

fields.description:
If I create a fairly complex custom workflow, many different steps along the way may have a similar transition.  For example, there may be several different points along the workflow where you can "Close Issue" or "Reopen Issue".

In the default JIRA workflow, there are two places where you can "Reopen Issue" and they magically share the ID 3.  If you copy this workflow, and then make a change to "Reopen Issue" (add a validation or something), it will appear in both places.  But if you make a new step, and give it a new transition "Reopen Issue", this is separate from the other ones (it will have a new ID).  Sometimes this is what you want, but usually it is not; if I impose a new restriction on "Reopen Issue" that says only a person in a certain role can do it, I want that to apply to everyone.

I figured out how to do this by exporting the XML, hacking it, and reimporting it, but this defeats the purpose of a WYSIWYG editor.  We really need one or both of the following:

1.  When creating a new transition, you should be able to choose if it is really new, or just shared with an existing one.
2.  It needs to be easier to copy conditions, validators, and post functions from one transition to another.
fields.summary: Needs to be easier to reuse transitions in a workflow

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-16736].
  {panel}

Confluence has a rich text editor and supports wiki markup.  I don't think JIRA needs to support all of these features, but communication would be greatly improved if we could have a toolbar that let you do the following:

* Bold, italic, and underlined text
* Automatic numbered or bulleted lists
* Color text
* Simple tables
* Ability to embed attached images

A field could be defined as "Rich Text", so custom fields could also support this.

Being able to embed attached images in the middle is important, right now they just get added in alphabetical order.  But sometimes when you're writing up a bug you're sort of telling a story.  I did this, and got this: (pic), and then I clicked this button, and got this: (pic)
fields.summary: Add enhanced formatting to Description and Comment fields

fields.description:
Steps to Reproduce:
1. Launch JIRA 4.0(using bamboo QA build 160 Trunk)
2. Select a filter from "filter" drop down on the top of the page.
3. Open the "Tools" drop down.

Scenario 2:
1. Open the "Find Issue" tab and perform a simple search to find issues.
2. Click on "Tools" to access the drop down menu.
 

Result:
1. "Bulk Change" text is clickable.

Expected:
1. "Bulk Change" text should be never clickable
fields.summary: "Bulk Change" text in "Tools" drop down changes to link in certain scenerios

fields.description:
Steps to Reproduce:
1. Launch JIRA 4.0(using bamboo QA build 160 Trunk)
2. Click on "Find Issue" tab and search some issue. Now save it as filter.
3. Click on filter to display the issues.

Result:
1. The filter name is not getting displayed at proper location on the left side of the screen. Screenshots of both 3.13.2(JAC) and 4.0 is attached.

Expected:
1. The filter name should be displayed properly
fields.summary: The filter name is not getting displayed at right location in "Find Issue" tab

fields.description:
Similar to JRA-10961.

Check if a value is selected in a select or multi-select custom field, and only make the condition pass if the value is selected.
fields.summary: Add workflow condition that checks the value of a multi-select custom field

fields.description:
When JIRA starts up the options in the bin/setenv script allow email processing. This is a problem with restored data in a test instance if you forget to disable it - emails destined for a production instance of JIRA get processed by the test instance. 
I suggest that email be disabled after a restore from XML action until explicitly enabled. This could be as simple as making the "Successful Restore" screen contain text about this and contain a link to the appropriate Admin page. For database restores, it's still a problem. This could have saved a number of my JIRA clients from being very puzzled when testing their backup JIRA "breaks" their production JIRA.
fields.summary: Make recovery process require email be explicitly enabled

fields.description:
Dear Atlassian Support,
I build the new jira version on my server and deployed it. When starting my jboss I get an error (see attachment).
I can't find the problem could you please help me?
Thank a lot.

Best regrads
Florian Gellrich
fields.summary: Jira deployment fails on jboss 3.2.6

fields.description:
It would be pretty usefull if the "show saved filter" allowed users to select what issue values to show.
For example to display the due date for the issues directly on the dashboard.
fields.summary: Customize display of filter columns

fields.description: This is actually http://developer.atlassian.com/jira/browse/JCHART-268. It's also created here because the relevant plugin classes/templates (in trunk) have been moved into JIRA.
fields.summary: Created vs Resolved: Link from Issue-Numbers in the Table to the corresponding searchrequest in the IssueNavigator

fields.description:
Steps:.
1. Launch JIRA 4.0(QA build 159) 
2. Create an issue and try to attach a file having % or $ in its file name.

Results:
1. It give error message of invalid character.
2. I have tested with lot many characters. file name with euro and pound are working fine.

Expected:
1. We should be allowing user to attach file with $ and % in their file name unless we are trying to avoid something critical.
fields.summary: File attachment having % in their file name are not allowed

fields.description:
Steps:
1. Launch JIRA 4.0(QA build 159).
2. Go to "Find Issue" tab and perform some search.
3. Try to access menu item from "View" and "Tools" drop down.

Result:
1. Nothing is happening when user clicks on it.

Expected:
1. user should be able to access the menu items
fields.summary: Nothing is happening if user click on "View" and "Tools" drop down menu in "Find Issue" tab
Project Picker Custom Field JQL Searching

fields.description: The project clause validator is not currently doing a permission check to see if the user can view the project. We need to make it do so. Same with the version and component validators.
fields.summary: Fix the project clause validator to do a permission check to see if the user can see the project

fields.description:
Currently when you specify a resolution as unresolved the JQL will generate resolution = -1. This should generate the unresolved() function.

We should also change the issue constants to put their names into the JQL since they are immutable. 

We should also put the project key instead of the project id.

Lets think of the other immutable values the searchers can enter when we do this.
fields.summary: Fix the immutable issue constants to fill in JQL clause values with readable values

fields.description:
This is actually http://developer.atlassian.com/jira/browse/JCHART-246.

This issue is created because the fix needs to be applied on some of the classes that were moved from the plugin's trunk to JIRA.
fields.summary: Created vs resolved report links still visible in the created vs resolved portlet even though the report module is disabled

fields.description: We need to figure out how to handle EMPTY's in lists. At the moment putting an empty into a list will not cause the query to bring back the empty results, it just gets ignored.
fields.summary: JQL does not handle EMPTY embedded in lists

fields.description:
There is a problem that we need to solve. The searcher only returns one field and this is the last field that it was registered with. The QuerySearcher gets registered with four fields and will keep only the last referenced field. When it performs a "doesItFit" it uses the field to see if the field is visible, this will only do a visibility check for the field that the searcher references.

You could have a case where the description field is hidden and only the summary field is being searched and the searcher says it does not fit because of description.
fields.summary: There is a bug with the way the QuerySearcher works with the "doesItFit"

fields.description:
Currenty the screenshot applet manually makes a HTTP request using Java URLConnection, without going via the browser. The current implmentation doesn't support HTTP Negotiate ([SPNEGO|http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/SPNEGO]) which provides SSO via NTLM / Kerberos. 

What happens is the server will return a 401 when the browser needs to authenticate, which the browser is expected to respond to. 

The screenshot applet trace looks like this:

{noformat}10.22.3.77 - - [10/Mar/2009:13:56:51 +0100] "GET /jira/secure/AttachFile!screenshot.jspa?
id=10343&sessionId=B295452DDA621E65BDF9D99E55560C86 HTTP/1.1" 401 - 0.001{noformat}

Whereas requesting other resources via the browser results in the following:

{noformat}10.22.3.77 - - [10/Mar/2009:13:56:51 +0100] "GET /jira/images/border/spacer.gif HTTP/1.1" 401 - 0.001
10.22.3.77 - - [10/Mar/2009:13:56:51 +0100] "GET /jira/images/border/spacer.gif HTTP/1.1" 304 - 0.003{noformat}

This means the screenshot applet will not work if you have implemented HTTP Negotiate / SPNEGO.
fields.summary: Screenshot Applet does not support HTTP Negotiate (SPNEGO)

fields.description: We often have long threads of conversations via email at our company.  Our workflow sends out email notifications (for example, a request to checkin to a frozen codebase) to a group of people, who then will probably want to converse via email to the entire group of recipients. This is impossible if one does not know who all of the recipients are.
fields.summary: Would it be possible to send email notifications that go to more than 1 recipient in 1 email with all recipients in the "To" instead of 1 individual email for each person?

fields.description: It is necessary to use the plugin Jira Suite utilities to create a customized workflow for my company.  It would be great if the functionality it provides were added to Jira proper.  Frankly, I am not sure how a halfway complicated workflow can be created without this functionality. Specifically, the ability to set values for customfields and to set conditions based upon certain values of customfields.
fields.summary: Incorporate workflow functionality of the Jira Suite Utilities plugin into Jira proper.
Finish off chart popup in Navigator
Issue Votes JQL searching
Set Default Permission Scheme

fields.description: Sorting statuses will allow to display them by plugins in the right order.
fields.summary: Add ability to sort statuses on View Statuses screen

fields.description:
Current mail queue implementation is based on a SingleMailQueueItem. The way the atlassian-mail is implemented each email establishes a new connection with the SMTP server resulting in a lot of overhead when sending a large number of emails on each service run. That overhead could be really eliminated if a new implementation would support send more that one email in a single batch.

I've entered an improvement issue also in atlassian-mail project, [MAIL-47].
fields.summary: Batch sending of emails in a single SMTP connection

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-16699].
  {panel}

Subject:
=======
Text formatting facilities should be provided while logging work on JIRA


Description:
=========
We don't have proper Text formatting facilities while logging work or adding comments on JIRA.

It would be great even if we have like NET forum.
fields.summary: Text formatting facilities should be provided while logging work on JIRA

fields.description:
I would like the add the ability to log SQL issued by JIRA and also have an interception point for knowing when SQL is being run and completed.  I would then wrap timers around those callback points.

This is a twenty percent time project for me.  So far its looking pretty good for JIRA 4.0
fields.summary: Have the ability to log all SQL statements issued by JIRA and also have a callback for timing purposes

fields.description:
Steps to Reproduce:
1. Launch JIRA.
2. Create/update an issue and enter  data in "Environment" and description field.
3. Click the "Preview" icon to see the value in preview mode.
4. Click "Create"/"Update".

Result:
1. The issue just get created with summary and data in description and Environment field is lost.
2. This is a critical issue as user is here loosing data if saved in preview mode.
3. User like Nanako , first view data in preview and then save as data is complex.

Expected:
1. No loss of data

Additional Info:
Working fine on JAC
fields.summary: Contents of Description/Environment field get lost if saved in preview mode

fields.description: Listeners could be pluggable, but aren't yet.  Enabling this would reduce manual configuration and simplify deployment of plugins making use of same.
fields.summary: Would like to be able to contribute Listener types via Plugin framework
MailListener (com.atlassian.jira.event.listeners.mail) - please add a getter for the MailQueue implementation

fields.description:
When I delete a project version, it prompts me to swap the "Affects Version/s" or "Fix Version/s" field values to another valid version.  It does this correctly, however I would expect that any custom fields which are "version" type would also be changed from the deleted version to the new version I have chosen.  It seems they are not changed, so the custom field values show up as blank after the version is deleted.

As a workaround, I guess I can run a SQL query to change the customfieldvalue for all issues in the project.

Thanks,
Bill
fields.summary: Deleting version and swapping to another version does not update custom fields

fields.description: Can you please update Atlassian's provided archetype to use the new version, or updating the documentation to warn of old dependencies and instruct how to find them?
fields.summary: Improve plugin documentation

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-16691].
  {panel}

At the moment the following happens:

1)  Create an issue and select a component, for example select Component A
2)  Edit the issue and add another component, for example select Component B
3)  Look at the Change History and see that the Original Value is blank and the new value is Component B

You can remove Component B during an edit operation (while leaving Component A selected) and notice that the Original Value is Component B and the New Value is blank.

This is because the change history stores and shows a "diff" of changes.

It would be easier to read if the full original and new values are shown. That is, in the example above, the original value would be Component A, and the new value would be Component A and Component B.
fields.summary: Show original and new values for multi value fields such as components and versions, as full lists rather than a diff of changes
com.atlassian.jira.mail.IssueMailQueueItem - please add a method: setRecipientList(Set)

fields.description:
We have defined a few custom issue types. They are assigned to a special issue type scheme. This scheme (and therefore also these issue types) are only used for one single project, by one single developer. However, when you click "Create new issue" in the top menu, the issue type list contains all these issue types for everybody. Also, when you create an issue with such a custom type on a project that doesn't have the issue type, you get no error message. Moreover, these issue types have a custom field configuration scheme, which is also ignored. In other words:

1. If none of the projects you have access to use a given issue type, the issue type should not be in the list on the "create new issue type" page
2. If some of the projects do use the issue type, but not all, trying to create an issue of that type in a project that doesn't have the type should raise an error message.

Thanks!
fields.summary: Issue type list in "Create new issue" page contains too many issue types

fields.description:
There are only two things included in this:  global-static and global (dynamic)
global already gets served out from stylesheettag.jsp, so it actually gets served twice.

Lets simply remove combined.css totally and simply just serve out two files, or move to the new batch system.
fields.summary: Removing CombinedCachingServlet for css
DOCTYPE declaration included twice for issue related pages
Enormous font on random pages

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-16683].
  {panel}

So I've got a long list of components and issue types, e.g:

* New feature
* Improvement
* Task
* New Employee Setup
* Specification
* Customer Initiative
* Blah
* Blum
* Boo

In https://jira.bepress.com/secure/project/DeleteComponent!default.jspa?cid=XXXX ,
If these issue types or components are in use, Jira makes me reassign them before deleting them.

Instead I'd like to deprecate them, so they can't be assigned to new tickets, but history is not changed.

My goal is to reduce clutter, when issue types are no longer relevant for _new_ tickets.


The same comment applies to several areas in the administrative GUI.  I want to "ghost out" old stuff, without changing history.
fields.summary: Ability to archive (deprecate) issue types (Issue Type Scheme)

fields.description:
When a long script is pasted into the JellyRunner it takes a long time to execute this script.  Often JellyRunner will return with an error "Could not execute script.".  The JellyRunner has run only about halfway through the script at this point and there's nothing special about the following tags.  In fact these execute correctly if executed separately in a new JellyRunner.

The extra information provided by the JellyRunner:

Error: <JiraJelly xmlns:jira="jelly:com.atlassian.jira.jelly.JiraTagLib">
Exception: org.apache.commons.jelly.JellyTagException: null:138:0: java.lang.NullPointerException
java.io.PrintWriter@412d02
fields.summary: Running long Jelly scripts can fail

fields.description:
Could a warning be displayed when issues or screens are being updated on other machines or browser tabs? For instance if you are updating a workflow, perhaps there could be a warning that the workflow page is being accessed by another user or if the page is open on other browser tabs. There is a plugin that has been created to alert users when multiple users are accessing/updating the same issue. See the following link:

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAEXT/JIRA+Visitor+Plugin

Initially it would be nice to limit the function to admin users and only pages they have access to such as workflow pages, permission pages, and other system critical pages. Could something similar be added to JIRA?
fields.summary: Multiple users updating issue warning (Race Condition)

fields.description:
If you have issue links enabled and have set the Outward Description and the Inward Description to be then same (ie: is linked to) then when you go to link an issue you will see two identical options in the list.  It would be much easier if there was only one option listed. 

Alternatively it would be nice if you could enter only one description and not be forced to enter a second on if it is not applicable.
fields.summary: On Link Issue, if Outward Description and Inward Description are the same, then two identical options show up in the select list
JIRA build information not included in dummy XML responses to search filter requests which users do not have access to

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

# Create a filter with a specific group for the assignee
# Save the filter
# Delete the group used in the first step
# Edit the filter again in simple edit mode, notice there is no error
# 'View >>' the filter, notice the error that comes up and complains about the invalid user group.
fields.summary: Filter doesn't display errors when first loading into simple edit mode
